result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J Kuick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, straight time, with credit for 2 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 9 MONTHS. Court grants transfer to Ozaukee County. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-AODA assessment
-Mental Health Assessment
-Maintain full time work, school, or combination of both
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges during the period of probation, or a civil judgment will be entered. 

Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Steven J Kuick in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Steven J Kuick in custody. Patrick O'Keefe appearing under the Student Practice Rules as supervised by Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Steven J Kuick not in court, in custody.  Morgan Willz supervised by Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Received & Filed, Victim Impact Statement. Case set for Plea & Sentencing Hearing in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Steven J Kuick in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a status conference date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with UWM Student Union, 2200 East Kenwood Boulevard, Milwaukee, WI.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Steven J Kuick in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Steven J Kuick in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
